it.polimi.ingsw.GC_32.Server.Network

Class MessageManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.ingsw.GC_32.Server.Network.MessageManager

  • public class MessageManager
extends java.lang.Object
    MessageManager is a singleton class which handle all the messages of the server. Given a message sent by a Game instance (or by another class of the program), MessageManager take this message ensuring that the message is inserted in the correct queue. MessageManager handles to type of sendQueue, one for each connection mode socket and RMI). It handles two queue for recived message as well, one for game-specfic game message and the other for messages that are common to all the instance of Game (i.e. for all the games)
    • instance: the instance of this singleton class
    • commonReceiveQueue: the recived queue used for game messages which are independent from the game
    • gameReceiveQueueList: HashMap which map each game with its received message queue
    • RMISendQueue: queue used to send messages throught RMI
    • socketSendQueue: queue used to send messages throught socket
    • chatManager: used to handle general message which doesn't influence the game, like chat mesasges
    • chatMessageTypeSet: a Set which is used to filter messages in order to allow chatManagerThread to handle them, only messages which must be handled by chatManagerThread are filtered
    • chatManagerThread: the thread which perform the action handled by chatManager
    See Also:
    GameMessage, ChatManager, SocketListener, SocketReaderThread, RmiServer, RmiListener

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      private MessageManager()
      inizialize MessageManager (inizialize all the queues and chatMessageTypeSet values, starts chatManager thread so it can handle chatMessageTypeSet messages)

      allows to retrive the queue of a specific game given his UUID

      allows to get the RMI send queue used to send message on RMI
      java.util.concurrent.ConcurrentLinkedQueue<GameMessage> getSocketSendQueue()
      allows to get the socket send queue used to send message on socket
      void putRecivedMessage(GameMessage message)
      put a given message into the correct sendQueue
      void registerGame(Game game)
      given a game, registerGame register that game instantiating a new entry in the gameReceivedQueueList, in this way all the GameMessage with the gameUUID of that game will be put in the correct queue
      void sendMessge(GameMessage gameMessage)
      put a given message into the correct send queue looking to the client connection mode. if the message is sent in broadcast the message is put in both the queue
